rxjs.Observable.from.map.filter.description:
from(ish: ObservableInput<T>, scheduler: Scheduler): Observable<T>
Creates an Observable from an Array, an array-like object, a Promise, an iterable object, or an Observable-like object.

rxjs.Observable.of.description:
of(values: ...T, scheduler: Scheduler): Observable<T>
Creates an Observable that emits some values you specify as arguments, immediately one after the other, and then emits a complete notification.

rxjs.Observable.fromEvent.description:
fromEvent(target: EventTargetLike, eventName: string, options: EventListenerOptions, selector: SelectorMethodSignature<T>): Observable<T> 
Creates an Observable that emits events of a specific type coming from the given event target.

rxjs.Observable.create.description:
create(subscribe: function(subscriber: Subscriber): TeardownLogic): Observable
Creates a new Observable that will execute the specified function when a Subscriber subscribes to it.

rxjs.Observable.empty.description: Creates an Observable that emits no items to the Observer and immediately emits a complete notification.

rxjs.Observable.fromPromise.description: Converts a Promises to an Observable sequence.

rxjs.Observable.interval.description: Returns an observable sequence that produces a value after each period.

rxjs.Observable.range.description: Generates an observable sequence of integral numbers within a specified range.
